info.title: Collection Core API
info.description: Common APIs for collection production systems communications. Ensure main use cases (CRUD cases, clients, etc.) and serve as a foundation for the higher level APIs

externalDocs.description:
# System description

CollDesk is a debt collection system used in several Europen countries by Intrum Group (Spain, Italy, Belgium, Ireland, Portugal). It provides functionality to support all required features to handle debt collection processes end-to-end. CollDesk system is build on Oracle database platform (PL/SQL). Windows application is used by regular users to perform day to day activities; this windows application is distributed and deployed to each workstation; it is built using Microsoft .NET VB. This section provides information on resources CollDesk system API is exposing by using Collection Core APIs as data model.

# Exposed resources and methods

Current CollDesk sAPI implementations supports Collection Core APIs methods listed below. Additional services can be developed per request if such need will appear.

### Get Cases

* GET /cases?clientId={clientId}&additionalFields={additionalFields} - _gets cases by client id_
* GET /cases/{caseId} - _gets case by case id_

### Get Transactions

* GET /cases/{caseId}/transactions - _gets transactions for specified case id_
* GET /cases/{caseId}/transactions/{transactionId} - _gets specified transaction for specified case id_

### Get Customers

* GET /cases/{caseId}/customers - _gets customers for specified case id_
* GET /customers/{customerId} - _gets customer information for specified customer id_

### Get Clients

* GET /clients/{clientId} - _gets client information for specified client id_

# Connection data

CollDesk sAPI uses OAuth 2.0 authorization, JWT token must be generated and sent as attributes.headers.Authorization parameter. Please follow steps below to generate the token:

get.description: Searches for the cases by given criteria

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: List of the client IDs in given production system

parameters.name: additionalFields
parameters.description: Specifies list of the additional information to be included int response of the cases list. To be used if standard list of fields is not enough. If specified, data provider to ensure that listed entities are populated

items.title: Collection case
items.description: Definition of the collection case as it is seen by the consumer. Initial draft from customer portal's perespective. This specification is created based on Customer portal use case. NB! To be evolved for the actual data model. See http://confluence.intrum.net/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=32179006 for detailed information

clientId.description: Client production system specific unique identifier

clientName.description: Name of the client as per production system

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

mainStatus.description: Catalyst main status code of the case

caseConcern.description: This is a descriptive text of what the debt is about, e.g. text ”Phone bill for April 2015”, ”Bank loan, agreement number 6363267”, and similar. The same text typically shows up as a heading on collection letters etc.

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs
ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs
ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

closingCode.description: Catalyst case closing code. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Closing+Codes for details.

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

productId.description: Catalyst product identifier. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Product+Identifiers for details

customers.description: List of all customers assigned to the case. This field is returned only if requested via additionalFields query parameter during GET /caeses call

items.description: Case specific customer information. This is generic customer information enriched with the properties meaningful within case scope only

personName.description: Name of the debtor if debtor is a person

personalId.description: Main unique identifier of the customer (e.g. SSN, personal code, etc.) if customer is a person

businessId.description: Company registration number, if customer is a company

language.description: Code of the default language used by the debtor

companyName.description: Name of the debtor if debtor is a company

contactInformation.description: List of the know contact information items

items.description: Definition of the single contact information item

type.description: P = fixed phone; M = mobile phone; F = fax; E = email; O = other

value.description: Actual contact information (e.g. email address or phone number, etc.)

scope.description: Defines where contact information leads (e.g. home phone , work phone, etc.) NB! Consider speciication of the possible values

addresses.description: List of the known addresses for the debtor. At least one address to be defined

type.description: Type of the address. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Address+Type for details

status.description: Status of the address. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Address+Status for details

postalCode.description: ZIP code of the specified address

state.description: State, county or similar of the address

countryCode.description: 3 letters code of the country for the address. Consider having enum here

gender.description: Gender of the person. Applicable for person debtors only

type.description: Main debtor's type. P = person, C = company

debtorRowNumber.description: This is a number that identifies a debtor record (so not necessarily a person). It is production system-generated; it could be a row ID for the debtor record or internal (production system generated) debtor identifier - the second one is preferable. It is used in Catalyst to relate records to each other, for example, which 3200 record that a specific 3209 record belongs to. This number is not hashed in Catalyst as it does not identify a person.

type.description: Customer type within the scope of the given case

status.description: Identifies customer status related to the given case

isMain.description: Identifies whether given customer is main within scope of the given case

suspension.description: Defines customer suspension information within scope of the given case

enabled.description: Defines whether collection is suspended or not

comment.description: Optional comment on the suspension reason

date.description: Date when suspension is set (only if enabled)

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs
ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

status.description: High level status of the case

interestDate.description: Date until which interest has been calculated last time.

post.description: Create new case for the given production system

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: Provide an url to the newly created resource

comments.description: Any comments for INTRUM relevant to the case

clientId.description: Client identifier as in target production system

caseCurrency.description: Main case currency identifier (3-letters currency code AS PER ISO-4127)

clientName.description: Name of the client as per production system

payments.description: payments reported on the case during creation

items.description: Object for payment registration together with the case submission

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

invoiceNumber.description: Client invoice number to which payment is made

invoices.description: List of the invoices assigned to the case

items.title: Collection invoice
items.description: Invoice object for the invoice submission for collection. NB! This is first draft version of the specification. Please see Catalyst 3300 record http://confluence.intrum.net/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=32867219 for detailed specification

invoiceId.description: Unique identifier of the invoice in callig application

type.description: Type of the invoice. Currently supporting just two types but may be extended to the actual needs

invoiceNumber.description: Invoice number as defined by the client

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

referenceRateCode.description: Reference (discount) interest code. Specific to Sweden. Empty values to be handled on prodsys side

category.description: Invoice category. Specific to Rekondis Sweden

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

facilityId.description: Facility id, used in utility companies

enforcementNumber.description: Enforcement number for the given case

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

caseConcern.description: This is a descriptive text of what the debt is about, e.g. text ”Phone bill for April 2015”, ”Bank loan, agreement number 6363267”, and similar. The same text typically shows up as a heading on collection letters etc.

mainStatus.description: Catalyst main status code of the case

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs
ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

closingCode.description: Catalyst case closing code. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Closing+Codes for details.

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

collector.description: Identification of the collector on INTRUM side responsible for the case. To according to the target production system definition

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

productId.description: Product identifier as in terget production system

currency.description: ISO-4127 currency code. Consider modifying to actual needs

customers.description: List of the customers (debtors) assigned to the case

items.description: Case specific customer information. This is generic customer information enriched with the properties meaningful within case scope only

personName.description: Name of the debtor if debtor is a person

personalId.description: Main unique identifier of the customer (e.g. SSN, personal code, etc.) if customer is a person

businessId.description: Company registration number, if customer is a company

language.description: Code of the default language used by the debtor

companyName.description: Name of the debtor if debtor is a company

scope.description: Defines where contact information leads (e.g. home phone , work phone, etc.) NB! Consider speciication of the possible values

addresses.description: List of the known addresses for the debtor. At least one address to be defined

type.description: Type of the address. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Address+Type for details

status.description: Status of the address. See http://confluence.intrum.net/display/CAT/Address+Status for details

postalCode.description: ZIP code of the specified address

state.description: State, county or similar of the address

countryCode.description: 3 letters code of the country for the address. Consider having enum here

gender.description: Gender of the person. Applicable for person debtors only

type.description: Main debtor's type. P = person, C = company

debtorRowNumber.description: This is a number that identifies a debtor record (so not necessarily a person). It is production system-generated; it could be a row ID for the debtor record or internal (production system generated) debtor identifier - the second one is preferable. It is used in Catalyst to relate records to each other, for example, which 3200 record that a specific 3209 record belongs to. This number is not hashed in Catalyst as it does not identify a person.

resourceType.description: Common resource type for the single item. Assumes authentication and enforces format of the different methods' requests and responses

tokenSecurity.description: Request validation via security token provided in requests header

Authorization.description: Authorization header must contain valid security token

401.description:
Unauthorized. Bad or expired token. This can happen if the access token
has been revoked or expired. To fix, re-authenticate
the user.

403.description:
Forbidden. Bad auth request (wrong consumer key, bad nonce, expired
timestamp...).
